articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel intensified strikes on Gaza hours after a ceasefire and hostage release deal was announced, residents and authorities in the Palestinian enclave said, and mediators sought to quell fighting ahead of the truce's start on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas ceasefire accord followed by airstrikes on Gaza, residents say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's anti-corruption agency will resume questioning impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol at 2 p.m. (0500 GMT) on Thursday afternoon, the Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: South Korea's anti-corruption agency to resume questioning Yoon on Thursday afternoon, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will meet with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Ukraine to sign a new 100-year partnership to deepen security ties, the prime minister's office said in a statement on Thursday.
articles.title: UK PM Starmer to travel to Ukraine to sign new treaty

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of France's lower house of parliament on Thursday warned of major risks if a no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Francois Bayrou's government succeeded, as it would hit areas such as the budget.
articles.title: French parliament head warns against backing no-confidence vote versus government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine downed 34 out of 55 drones launched by Russia in an overnight attack, the Ukrainian air force said on Thursday, with a further 18 failing to reach their targets, something which usually indicates they were jammed by electronic warfare.
articles.title: Ukraine says it downed 34 Russian drones in overnight attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cyprus on Thursday hailed a U.S. memorandum allowing military sales, including arms, to the island as a milestone affirming recognition of the island as a pillar of stability in the east Mediterranean region which has been fraught with conflict.
articles.title: Cyprus says US decree on security affirms island's stabilising role in region

articles.author: Siyabonga Sishi
articles.description: South African police lowered a camera down more than a mile (1.5 km) underground into an illegal gold mine on Thursday to ascertain if any survivors or corpses were still there after a months-long siege by authorities in which at least 78 miners died.
articles.title: South African police lower cage into mine to check if anyone left after 78 died

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The ceasefire in Gaza represents a "great victory" for the Palestinian resistance, Iran's Revolutionary Guards said on Thursday, warning against any possible breach by Israel.
articles.title: Iran says Gaza ceasefire is a 'victory' for Palestinian resistance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has called the country's business leaders to a meeting on Thursday after U.S. President-elect Donald Trump last week threatened military or economic action such as tariffs to take control of Greenland.
articles.title: Denmark's prime minister summons business leaders following Trump's Greenland threat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia on Thursday accused NATO and the West of making "evidence-free" allegations against Moscow over ships purportedly involved in sabotaging undersea cables in an effort to curb sea-borne Russian oil exports.
articles.title: Russia says Western claims of Russian undersea cable sabotage aim to curb sea-borne Russian oil exports
